    "patch": "@@ -110,9 +110,9 @@ Users must have a way to get MFA and register passwordless sign-in or FIDO2 in a\n > [!IMPORTANT]\n > A user is considered MFA capable if their username appears in the CBA method settings. In this scenario, the user can't use their identity as part of their authentication to register other available methods. Make sure that users without a valid certificate aren't included in the CBA method settings. For more information about how authentication works, see [Microsoft Entra multifactor authentication](../authentication/concept-mfa-howitworks.md).\n \n-## Options to get MFA capability with single-factor certificates\n+## Options to get MFA capability with CBA enabled\n \n-Microsoft Entra CBA can be either single-factor or multifactor depending on the tenant configuration. Turning on CBA makes a user potentially capable of completing MFA. A user that has a single-factor certificate must use another factor to complete MFA.\n+Microsoft Entra CBA can be either single-factor or multifactor depending on the tenant configuration. Turning on CBA makes a user potentially capable of completing MFA. A user that has a single-factor certificate or password must use another factor to complete MFA. \n \n We don't allow registration of other methods without first satisfying MFA. If the user doesn't have any other MFA method registered and is in scope for CBA, the user can't use identity proof to register other authentication methods and get MFA.\n \n@@ -654,4 +654,4 @@ An external identity B2B guest user can use CBA on the home tenant.     "patch": "@@ -23,7 +23,7 @@ This article explains the prerequisites, and steps, to configure User Source of\n | **Roles** | [Hybrid Administrator](/entra/identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference#hybrid-administrator) is required to call the Microsoft Graph APIs to read and update SOA of users.<br>[Application Administrator](/entra/identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference#application-administrator) or [Cloud Application Administrator](/entra/identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference#cloud-application-administrator) is required to grant user consent to the required permissions to Microsoft Graph Explorer or the app used to call the Microsoft Graph APIs. |\n | **Permissions** | For apps calling into the `onPremisesSyncBehavior` Microsoft Graph API, the `User-OnPremisesSyncBehavior.ReadWrite.All` permission scope needs to be granted. For more information, see [how to consent to this permission](how-to-user-source-of-authority-configure.md#consent-permission-to-apps) using the Microsoft Entra Admin Center. |\n | **License needed** | Microsoft Entra Free license. |\n-| **Connect Sync client** | Minimum version is [2.5.76.0](/entra/identity/hybrid/connect/reference-connect-version-history#25760) |\n+| **Connect Sync client** | Minimum version is [2.5.76.0](/entra/identity/hybrid/connect/reference-connect-version-history#25760). To use Contact SOA, version [2.5.79.0](../../identity/hybrid/connect/reference-connect-version-history.md#25790).  |\n | **Cloud Sync client** | Minimum version is [1.1.1370.0](/entra/identity/hybrid/cloud-sync/reference-version-history#1113700)|\n \n \n@@ -56,6 +56,9 @@ You can consent permission in the Microsoft Entra admin center. This highly priv\n \n Follow these steps to grant `User-OnPremisesSyncBehavior.ReadWrite.All` permission to the corresponding app. For more information about how to add new permissions to your app registration and grant consent, see [Update an app's requested permissions in Microsoft Entra ID](/entra/identity-platform/howto-update-permissions). \n \n+> [!NOTE]\n+> To transfer SOA of a Contact, the required permission is `Contacts-OnPremisesSyncBehavior.ReadWrite.All`.\n+\n ### Use Microsoft Entra admin center to consent permission to apps \n \n 1. Sign in to the [Microsoft Entra admin center](https://entra.microsoft.com) as an [Application Administrator](~/identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#application-administrator) or a [Cloud Application Administrator](~/identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#cloud-application-administrator).\n@@ -84,6 +87,9 @@ Follow these steps to grant `User-OnPremisesSyncBehavior.ReadWrite.All` permissi\n \n ## Transfer SOA for a test user\n \n+> [!NOTE]\n+> You're also able to transfer contact SOA using the `https://graph.microsoft.com/v1.0/contacts` API endpoint.\n+\n Follow these steps to transfer the SOA for a test user:\n \n 1.     "patch": "@@ -19,6 +19,14 @@ Organizations are increasingly adopting a cloud-first approach to modernize thei\n This article introduces the concept of user SOA, its benefits, and the scenario it supports. It also outlines key considerations and prerequisites for IT administrators planning to shift user management to the cloud using Microsoft Entra ID. By using user SOA, organizations can streamline user lifecycle management, enable advanced governance capabilities, and fully embrace a cloud-first posture. For a guide on using user SOA for IT architects, see: [Cloud-First identity management: Guidance for IT architects](guidance-it-architects-source-of-authority.md).\n \n \n+\n+## Video: Microsoft Entra User Source of Authority\n+\n+\n+Check out this video for an introduction to SOA and how it can help you shift to the cloud:\n+\n+> [!VIDEO https://www.youtube.com/embed/QnY-D5bdh4Y]\n+\n ## User SOA scenario\n  \n The next sections explain more details about the scenario that User SOA supports."

    "patch": "@@ -1,58 +0,0 @@\n----\n-title: View a list and description of all system reports available in Permissions Management reports\n-description: View a list and description of all system reports available in Permissions Management.\n-author: jenniferf-skc\n-manager: pmwongera\n-ms.service: entra-permissions-management\n-\n-ms.topic: how-to\n-ms.date: 04/01/2025\n-ms.author: jfields\n----\n-\n-\n-# View a list and description of system reports\n-\n-> [!NOTE]\n-> Effective April 1, 2025, Microsoft Entra Permissions Management will no longer be available for purchase, and on November 1, 2025, we'll retire and discontinue support of this product. More information can be found [here](https://aka.ms/MEPMretire). \n-\n-Microsoft Entra Permissions Management has various types of system reports that capture specific sets of data. These reports allow management, auditors, and administrators to:\n-\n-- Make timely decisions.\n-- Analyze trends and system/user performance.\n-- Identify trends in data and high risk areas so that management can address issues more quickly and improve their efficiency.\n-\n-This article provides you with a list and description of the system reports available in Permissions Management. Depending on the report, you can download it in comma-separated values (**CSV**) format, portable document format (**PDF**), or Microsoft Excel Open XML Spreadsheet (**XLSX**) format.\n-\n-## Download a system report\n-\n-1. In the Permissions Management home page, select the **Reports** tab, and then select the **Systems Reports** subtab.\n-1. In the **Report Name** column, find the report you want, and then select the down arrow to the right of the report name to download the report.\n-\n-    Or, from the ellipses **(...)** menu, select **Download**.\n-\n-    The following message displays: **Successfully Started To Generate On Demand Report.**\n-\n-\n-## Summary of available system reports\n-\n-| Report name                | Type of the report                | File format              | Description               | Availability                | Collated report?                 |\n-|----------------------------|-----------------------------------|--------------------------|---------------------------| ----------------------------|----------------------------------|\n-| Access Key Entitlements and Usage Report                | Summary </p>Detailed                | CSV                 | This report displays: </p> - Access key age, last rotation date, and last usage date availability in the summary report. Use this report to decide when to rotate access keys. </p> - Granted task and Permissions creep index (PCI) score. This report provides supporting information when you want to take the action on the keys.                | AWS</p>Azure</p>GCP                 | Yes      |\n-| All Permissions for Identity                 | Summary                 | CSV                | This report lists all the assigned permissions for the selected identities.                | AWS</p>Azure</p>GCP            | N/A      |\n-| Group Entitlements and Usage       | Summary                | CSV                | This report tracks all group level entitlements and the permission assignment, PCI. The number of members is also listed as part of this report.                 | AWS</p>Azure</p>GCP                 | Yes      |\n-| Identity Permissions                 | Summary                | CSV                 | This report tracks any, or specific, task usage per **User**, **Group**, **Role**, or **App**.                 | AWS</p>Azure</p>GCP                 | N/A      |\n-| AWS Role Policy Audit       | Detailed | CSV | This report gives the list of AWS roles, which can be assumed by **User**, **Group**, **resource** or **AWS Role**.                | AWS | N/A      |\n-| Cross Account Access Details| Detailed                 | CSV                 | This report helps track **User**, **Group** from other AWS accounts have cross account access to the specified AWS account.                | AWS                | N/A      |\n-| PCI History                 | Summary                 | CSV                 | This report helps track **Monthly PCI History** for each authorized system. It can be used to plot the trend of the PCI.                 | AWS</p>Azure</p>GCP                 | Yes      |\n-| Permissions Analytics Report (PAR)  |     Detailed                 | XSLX, PDF                 | This report lists the different key findings in the selected authorized systems. The key findings include **Super identities**, **Inactive identities**, **Over-provisioned active identities**, **Storage bucket hygiene**, **Access key age (AWS)**, and so on. </p>This report helps administrators to visualize the findings across the organization and make decisions.                    | AWS</p>Azure</p>GCP                | Yes for XSLX     |\n-| Role/Policy Details                 | Summary                 | CSV                | This report captures **Assigned/Unassigned** and **Custom/system policy with used/unused condition** for specific or all AWS accounts. </p>Similar data can be captured for Azure and GCP for assigned and unassigned roles.                | AWS</p>Azure</p>GCP                 | No      |\n-| User Entitlements and Usage     | Detailed <p>Summary <p> Permissions                | CSV                 | **Summary** This report provides the summary view of all the identities with Permissions Creep Index (PCI), granted and executed tasks per Azure subscription, AWS account, GCP project.     </p>**Detailed** This report provides a detailed view of Azure role assignments, GCP role assignments and AWS policy assignment along with Permissions Creep Index (PCI), tasks used by each identity. </p>**Permissions** This report provides the list of role assignments for Azure, GCP and policy assignments in AWS per identity.                 | AWS</p>Azure</p>GCP                | Yes      |\n-\n-\n-## Next steps\n-\n-- For information on how to view system reports in the **Reports** dashboard, see [View system reports in the Reports dashboard](product-reports.md).\n-- For information about how to create, view, and share a system report, see [Create, view, and share a custom report](report-view-system-report.md).\n-- For information about how to create and view a custom report, see [Generate and view a custom report](report-create-custom-report.md).\n-- For information about how to create and view the Permissions analytics report, see [Generate and download the Permissions analytics report](product-permissions-analytics-reports.md)."
  },

    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Ferror-codes-onboarding.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Ferror-codes-onboarding.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Ferror-codes-onboarding.md?ref=446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a",
    "patch": "@@ -1,105 +0,0 @@\n----\n-title: Error codes when onboarding Permissions Management\n-description: Understand potential error codes that may appear during onboarding of Microsoft Entra Permissions Management\n-author: jenniferf-skc\n-manager: pmwongera\n-ms.service: entra-permissions-management\n-\n-ms.topic: reference\n-ms.date: 04/01/2025\n-ms.author: jfields\n----\n-\n-# Error codes: Microsoft Entra Permissions Management \n-\n-> [!NOTE]\n-> Effective April 1, 2025, Microsoft Entra Permissions Management will no longer be available for purchase, and on November 1, 2025, we'll retire and discontinue support of this product. More information can be found [here](https://aka.ms/MEPMretire).\n-\n-During onboarding, Microsoft Entra Permissions Management may return error messages that an admin can triage. This article lists data collection error messages and their descriptions shown in the Permissions Management UI, along with proposed solutions.\n-\n-\n-## AWS_ACCESSADVISOR_COLLECTION_ERROR \n-\n-This accountdoesnothave permissions toview```ServiceLastAccessed```. \n-\n-### Proposed solution\n-\n-- Verify that you're signed in using Management Account credentials. The AWS account must have a policy that has permissions to generate, get, or list ```ServiceLastAccessDetails``` or equivalent permissions. \n-- In the AWS Management Console, verify that Service Control Policies (SCPs) are enabled in your organization root.\n-\n-## AWS_CLOUDTRAIL_DISABLED\n-\n-The AWS environment doesn't have CloudTrail configured, or you don't have permissions to access CloudTrail.\n-\n-### Proposed solution\n-\n-CloudTrail is automatically created when an AWS account is created. \n-\n-To access:\n-- Verify you're signed in using Management Account credentials.\n-- Enable CloudTrail as a trusted service in your AWS organization.\n-- Ensure that the AWS account has the CloudTrail managed policies ```AWSCloudTrail_FullAccess```, ```AWSCloudTrail_ReadOnlyAccess```, or is granted equivalent permissions.\n-\n-## AWS_CLOUDTRAIL_S3_ACCESS_DENIED \n-\n-Thisaccountdoesn'thavepermissions toaccessS3BucketCloudTraillogs. \n-\n-### Proposed solution\n-\n-Steps to try:\n-- Verify you're signed in using Management Account credentials.\n-- Enable CloudTrail as a trusted service in your AWS organization.\n-- The AWS account must have the CloudTrail managed policy ```AWSCloudTrail_FullAccess``` or have been granted equivalent permissions.\n-- For cross-account access, each account must have an IAM role with an access policy that grants access.\n-- CloudTrail must have the required permissions to deliver log files to the S3 bucket and S3 bucket policies are updated to receive and store log files.\n-\n-## AWS_LDAP_CREDENTIALS_INVALID \n-\n-InvalidLDAPCredentials. \n-\n-### Proposed Solution\n-\n-Verify that the hard drive on your domain controller is not full.\n-\n-\n-## AWS_LDAP_UNREACHABLE \n-\n-ConnectionfailurewhiletryingtoaccessLDAPservice. \n-\n-\n-### Proposed solution\n-\n-This issue is common with the AWS Managed Microsoft AD Connector used to enable LDAPS. Verify if the AD connector can communicate via TCP and UDP over the 88 (Kerberos) and 389 (LDAP) ports.\n-\n-## AWS_SYSTEM_ROLE_POLICIES_COLLECTION_ERROR \n-\n-ErrorduringthecollectionofSystemrolepolicies.\n-\n-### Proposed solution\n-\n-If your system role policies include Service Control Policies (SCPs), verify you're signed in using Management Account credentials. The AWS account must have the required permissions to display the policies details and attached entities.\n-\n-\n-## ERROR_GCP_PROJECT_MIN_PERMISSION\n-\n-InsufficientProjectpermissions. \n-\n-### Proposed solution\n-\n-Verify you have been granted the correct IAM roles or roles with equivalent permissions that grant access to the project: *Organization Admin*, *Security Admin*, or *Project IAM Admin*.\n-\n-\n-## ERROR_NO_IDENTIFIER_URIS_IN_APP\n-\n-NoIdentifierURIsconfiguredforapp. \n-\n-### Proposed solution\n-\n-- Verify the application configuration for the configured Identifier URIs in the portal. \n-- Check the Microsoft Entra applications manifest file. \n-\n-\n-## Next steps\n-\n-- For information on how to onboard an Amazon Web Services (AWS) account, see [Onboard an Amazon Web Services (AWS) account](onboard-aws.md).\n-- For information on how to onboard an account after initial onboarding, see [Add an account/subscription/project after onboarding](onboard-add-account-after-onboarding.md)"
  },

    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Ffaqs.md?ref=446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a",
    "patch": "@@ -1,203 +0,0 @@\n----\n-title: Frequently asked questions (FAQs) about Microsoft Entra Permissions Management\n-description: Frequently asked questions (FAQs) about Microsoft Entra Permissions Management.\n-author: jenniferf-skc\n-manager: pmwongera\n-ms.service: entra-permissions-management\n-\n-ms.topic: faq\n-ms.date: 04/01/2025\n-ms.author: jfields\n----\n-\n-# Frequently asked questions (FAQs)\n-\n-> [!NOTE]\n-> Effective April 1, 2025, Microsoft Entra Permissions Management will no longer be available for purchase, and on November 1, 2025, we'll retire and discontinue support of this product. More information can be found [here](https://aka.ms/MEPMretire).\n-\n-This article answers frequently asked questions (FAQs) about Microsoft Entra Permissions Management.\n-\n-## What's Microsoft Entra Permissions Management?\n-\n-Microsoft Entra Permissions Management (Permissions Management) is a cloud infrastructure entitlement management (CIEM) solution that provides comprehensive visibility into permissions assigned to all identities. For example, over-privileged workload and user identities, actions, and resources across multicloud infrastructures in Microsoft Azure, Amazon Web Services (AWS), and Google Cloud Platform (GCP). Permissions Management detects, automatically right-sizes, and continuously monitors unused and excessive permissions. It deepens the Zero Trust security strategy by augmenting the least privilege access principle.\n-\n-## What are the prerequisites to use Permissions Management?\n-\n-Permissions Management supports data collection from AWS, GCP, and/or Microsoft Azure. For data collection and analysis, customers are required to have a Microsoft Entra account to use Permissions Management.\n-\n-<a name='can-a-customer-use-permissions-management-if-they-have-other-identities-with-access-to-their-iaas-platform-that-arent-yet-in-azure-ad'></a>\n-\n-## Can a customer use Permissions Management if they have other identities with access to their IaaS platform that aren't yet in Microsoft Entra ID?\n-\n-Yes, a customer can detect, mitigate, and monitor the risk for AWS IAM or GCP accounts, or from other identity providers such as Okta or AWS IAM.\n-\n-## Where can customers access Permissions Management?\n-\n-Customers can access the Permissions Management interface from the [Microsoft Entra admin center](https://entra.microsoft.com/) .\n-\n-## Can noncloud customers use Permissions Management on-premises?\n-\n-No, Permissions Management is a hosted cloud offering.\n-\n-## Can non-Azure customers use Permissions Management?\n-\n-Yes, non-Azure customers can use our solution. Permissions Management is a multicloud solution so even customers who have no subscription to Azure can benefit from it.\n-\n-## Is Permissions Management available for tenants hosted in the European Union (EU)?\n-\n-Yes, Permissions Management is currently for tenants hosted in the European Union (EU).\n-\n-<a name='if-im-already-using-azure-ad--privileged-identity-management-pim-for-azure-what-value-does-permissions-management-provide'></a>\n-\n-## If I'm already using Microsoft Entra ID  Privileged Identity Management (PIM) for Azure, what value does Permissions Management provide?\n-\n-Permissions Management complements Microsoft Entra PIM. Microsoft Entra PIM provides just-in-time access for admin roles in Azure and Microsoft Online Services and apps that use groups. Permissions Management allows multicloud discovery, remediation, and monitoring of privileged access across Azure, AWS, and GCP.\n-\n-## What public cloud infrastructures does Permissions Management support?\n-\n-Permissions Management currently supports the three major public clouds: Amazon Web Services (AWS), Google Cloud Platform (GCP), and Microsoft Azure.\n-\n-## Does Permissions Management support hybrid environments?\n-\n-Permissions Management currently doesn't support hybrid environments.\n-\n-## What types of identities does Permissions Management support?\n-\n-Permissions Management supports user identities (for example, employees, customers, external partners) and workload identities (for example, virtual machines, containers, web apps, serverless functions).\n-\n-## Is Permissions Management available in Government Cloud?\n-\n-No, Permissions Management is currently not available in Government clouds.\n-\n-## Is Permissions Management available for sovereign clouds?\n-\n-No, Permissions Management is currently not available in sovereign Clouds.\n-\n-## How does Permissions Management collect insights about permissions usage?\n-\n-Permissions Management has a data collector that collects access permissions that are assigned to various identities, activity logs, and resources metadata. The data collector provides full visibility into permissions granted to all identities to access the resources and details on usage of granted permissions.\n-\n-## How does Permissions Management evaluate cloud permissions risk?\n-\n-Permissions Management offers granular visibility into all identities and their permissions granted versus used, across cloud infrastructures to uncover any action performed by any identity on any resource. The visibility isn't limited to just user identities, but also workload identities such as virtual machines, access keys, containers, and scripts. The dashboard gives an overview of permission profile to locate the riskiest identities and resources.\n-\n-## What is the Permissions Creep Index?\n-\n-The Permissions Creep Index (PCI) is a quantitative measure of risk associated with an identity or role determined by comparing permissions granted versus permissions exercised. It allows users to instantly evaluate the level of risk associated with the number of unused or over-provisioned permissions across identities and resources. It measures how much damage identities can cause based on the permissions they have.\n-\n-## How can customers use Permissions Management to delete unused or excessive permissions?\n-\n-Permissions Management allows users to right-size excessive permissions and automate least privilege policy enforcement with just a few clicks. The solution continuously analyzes historical permission usage data for each identity and gives customers the ability to right-size the permissions of that identity to permissions that are only being used for day-to-day operations. All unused and other risky permissions can be automatically removed.\n-\n-## Why is a user I deleted still visible in the Analytics tab?\n-\n-Check to see if the user was assigned a *Classic Administrator* role. Classic admin roles don't go away when a user is deleted. To resolve this, go to the [Classic admin page](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2268264) and delete that role assignment separately for the user.\n-\n-## How can customers grant permissions on-demand with Permissions Management?\n-\n-For any break-glass or one-off scenarios where an identity needs to perform a specific set of actions on a set of specific resources, the identity can request those permissions on-demand for a limited period with a self-service workflow. Customers can either use the built-in workflow engine or their IT service management (ITSM) tool. The user experience is the same for any identity type, identity source (local, enterprise directory, or federated) and cloud.\n-\n-## What is the difference between permissions on-demand and just-in-time access?\n-\n-Just-in-time (JIT) access is a method used to enforce the principle of least privilege to ensure identities are given the minimum level of permissions to perform the task at hand. Permissions on-demand are a type of JIT access that allows the temporary elevation of permissions, enabling identities to access resources on a by-request, timed basis.\n-\n-## How can customers monitor permissions usage with Permissions Management?\n-\n-Customers only need to track the evolution of their Permission Creep Index (PCI) to monitor permissions usage. Customers can monitor PCI in the **Analytics** tab from their Permissions Management dashboard.\n-\n-## Can customers generate permissions usage reports?\n-\n-Yes, Permissions Management has various types of system report available that capture specific data sets. These reports allow customers to:\n-- Make timely decisions.\n-- Analyze usage trends and system/user performance.\n-- Identify high-risk areas.\n-\n-For information about permissions usage reports, see [Generate and download the Permissions analytics report](product-permissions-analytics-reports.md).\n-\n-## Does Permissions Management integrate with third-party ITSM (Information Technology Service Management) tools?\n-\n-Integration with ITSM tools, such as ServiceNow, is in the future roadmap.\n-\n-## How is Permissions Management being deployed?\n-\n-Customers assigned the [Permissions Management Administrator](../identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#permissions-management-administrator) role must first onboard Permissions Management to their Microsoft Entra tenant, and then onboard their AWS accounts, GCP projects, and Azure subscriptions. More details about onboarding can be found in our [product documentation](onboard-enable-tenant.md).\n-\n-## How long does it take to deploy Permissions Management?\n-\n-It depends on each customer and how many AWS accounts, GCP projects, and Azure subscriptions they have.\n-\n-## Once Permissions Management is deployed, how fast can I get permissions insights?\n-\n-Once fully onboarded with data collection setup, customers can access permissions usage insights within hours. Our machine-learning engine refreshes the Permission Creep Index every hour so that customers can start their risk assessment right away.\n-\n-## Is Permissions Management collecting and storing sensitive personal data?\n-\n-No, Permissions Management doesn't have access to sensitive personal data.\n-\n-## Where can I find more information about Permissions Management?\n-\n-You can read our [blog](https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-entra-azure-ad-blog/bg-p/Identity) and visit our [web page](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/security/business/identity-access/microsoft-entra-permissions-management). You can also get in touch with your Microsoft point of contact to schedule a demo.\n-\n-## What is the data destruction/decommission process?\n-\n-If a customer initiates a free Permissions Management 45-day trial and does not convert to a paid license within 45 days of the trial expiration, all collected data is deleted within 30 days of the trial expiration date.  \n-\n-If a customer decides to discontinue licensing the service, all previously collected data is deleted within 30 days of license termination.\n-\n-Customers can also remove, export or modify specific data if a [Permissions Management Administrator](../identity/role-based-access-control/permissions-reference.md#permissions-management-administrator) using the Permissions Management service files an official Data Subject Request. To file a request:\n-\n-If you're an enterprise customer, you can contact your Microsoft representative, account team, or tenant admin to file a high-priority IcM support ticket requesting a Data Subject Request. Do not include details or any personally identifiable information in the IcM request. We'll reach out to you for these details only after an IcM is filed.\n-\n-If you're a self-service customer (you set up a trial or paid license in the Microsoft 365 admin center) you can contact the Permissions Management privacy team by selecting your profile drop-down menu, then **Account Settings** in Permissions Management. Follow the instructions to make a Data Subject Request.\n-\n-Learn more about [Azure Data Subject Requests](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2245178).\n-\n-<a name='do-i-require-a-license-to-use-entra-permissions-management-'></a>\n-\n-## Do I require a license to use Microsoft Entra Permissions Management? \n-\n-Yes, as of July 1, 2022, new customers must acquire a free 45-day trial license or a paid license to use the service. You can enable a trial here: [https://aka.ms/TryPermissionsManagement](https://aka.ms/TryPermissionsManagement) or you can directly purchase resource-based licenses here: [https://aka.ms/BuyPermissionsManagement](https://aka.ms/BuyPermissionsManagement) \n-\n-## How is Permissions Management priced? \n-\n-Permissions Management is $125 per resources/year ($10.40 per resource/month). Permissions Management requires licenses for workloads, which include any resource that uses compute or memory. \n-\n-## Do I need to pay for all resources?\n-\n-Although Permissions Management supports all resources, Microsoft only requires licenses for billable resources per cloud environment. To learn more about billable resources, visit [View billable resources listed in your authorization system](product-data-billable-resources.md)\n-\n-## How do I calculate the number of billable resources I have? \n-\n-To calculate the billable resources you have across your multicloud infrastructure, you must first activate a [45-day free trial](https://aka.ms/TryPermissionsManagement) of Permissions Management or [purchase a paid license](https://aka.ms/BuyPermissionsManagement). In Permissions Management, select **Settings** (gear icon), then click the **Billable Resources** tab. View the amount of billable resources in the **Total Number of Licenses** column.\n-\n-## What do I do if Im using the legacy version of the CloudKnox service?  \n-\n-We are currently working on developing a migration plan to help customers on the original CloudKnox service move to the new Microsoft Entra Permissions Management service later in 2022.   \n-\n-<a name='can-i-use-entra-permissions-management-in-the-eu--'></a>\n-\n-## Can I use Microsoft Entra Permissions Management in the EU?  \n-\n-Yes, the product is compliant.  \n-\n-## How to I enable one of the new 18 languages supported in the GA release? \n-\n-We are now localized in 18 languages. We respect your browser setting or you can manually enable your language of choice by adding a query string suffix to your Microsoft Entra Permissions Management URL:  \n-\n-`?lang=xx-XX` \n-\n-Where xx-XX is one of the following available language parameters: 'cs-CZ', 'de-DE', 'en-US', 'es-ES', 'fr-FR', 'hu-HU', 'id-ID', 'it-IT', 'ja-JP', 'ko-KR', 'nl-NL', 'pl-PL', 'pt-BR', 'pt-PT', 'ru-RU', 'sv-SE', 'tr-TR', 'zh-CN', or 'zh-TW'. \n-\n-## Resources\n-\n-- [Microsoft Entra blog](https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/t5/microsoft-entra-azure-ad-blog/bg-p/Identity)\n-- [Permissions Management web page](https://microsoft.com/security/business/identity-access-management/permissions-management)\n-- For more information about Microsoft's privacy and security terms, see[Commercial Licensing Terms](https://www.microsoft.com/licensing/terms/product/ForallOnlineServices/all). \n-- For more information about Microsoft's data processing and security terms when you subscribe to a product, see [Microsoft Products and Services Data Protection Addendum (DPA)](https://www.microsoft.com/licensing/docs/view/Microsoft-Products-and-Services-Data-Protection-Addendum-DPA).\n-- For more information, see [Azure Data Subject Requests for the GDPR and CCPA](/compliance/regulatory/gdpr-dsr-azure).\n-\n-## Next steps\n-\n-- For an overview of Permissions Management, see [What's Microsoft Entra Permissions Management?](overview.md).\n-- Deepen your learning with the [Introduction to Microsoft Entra Permissions Management](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2240016) learn module.\n-- For information on how to onboard Permissions Management in your organization, see [Enable Permissions Management in your organization](onboard-enable-tenant.md)."
  },

    "sha": "439eb4df8981b200f3eb0150aab1fab11713e099",
    "filename": "docs/permissions-management/how-to-add-remove-role-task.md",
    "status": "removed",
    "additions": 0,
    "deletions": 107,
    "changes": 107,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fhow-to-add-remove-role-task.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fhow-to-add-remove-role-task.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fhow-to-add-remove-role-task.md?ref=446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a",
    "patch": "@@ -1,107 +0,0 @@\n----\n-title: Add and remove roles and tasks for groups, users, and service accounts for Microsoft Azure and Google Cloud Platform (GCP) identities in the Remediation dashboard in Permissions Management\n-description: How to attach and detach permissions for groups, users, and service accounts for Microsoft Azure and Google Cloud Platform (GCP) identities in the Remediation dashboard in Permissions Management.\n-author: jenniferf-skc\n-manager: pmwongera\n-ms.service: entra-permissions-management\n-\n-ms.topic: how-to\n-ms.date: 04/01/2025\n-ms.author: jfields\n----\n-\n-# Add and remove roles and tasks for Microsoft Azure and Google Cloud Platform (GCP) identities\n-\n-> [!NOTE]\n-> Effective April 1, 2025, Microsoft Entra Permissions Management will no longer be available for purchase, and on November 1, 2025, we'll retire and discontinue support of this product. More information can be found [here](https://aka.ms/MEPMretire).\n-\n-This article describes how you can add and remove roles and tasks for Microsoft Azure and Google Cloud Platform (GCP) identities using the **Remediation** dashboard.\n-\n-> [!NOTE]\n-> To view the **Remediation** tab, your must have **Viewer**, **Controller**, or **Administrator** permissions. To make changes on this tab, you must have **Controller** or **Administrator** permissions. If you don't have these permissions, contact your system administrator.\n-\n-## View permissions\n-\n-1. On the Permissions Management home page, select the **Remediation** tab, and then select the **Permissions** subtab.\n-1. From the **Authorization System Type** dropdown, select **Azure** or **GCP**.\n-1. From the **Authorization System** dropdown, select the accounts you want to access.\n-1. From the **Search For** dropdown, select **Group**, **User**, or **APP**.\n-1. To search for more parameters, you can make a selection from the **User States**, **Permission Creep Index**, and **Task Usage** dropdowns.\n-1. Select **Apply**.\n-    Microsoft Entra ID displays a list of groups, users, and service accounts that match your criteria.\n-1. In **Enter a username**, enter or select a user.\n-1. In **Enter a Group Name**, enter or select a group, then select **Apply**.\n-1. Make a selection from the results list.\n-\n-    The table displays the **Username** **Domain/Account**, **Source**, **Resource** and **Current Role**.\n-\n-\n-## Add a role\n-\n-1. On the Permissions Management home page, select the **Remediation** tab, and then select the **Permissions** subtab.\n-1. From the **Authorization System Type** dropdown, select **Azure** or **GCP**.\n-1. From the **Authorization System** dropdown, select the accounts you want to access.\n-1. From the **Search For** dropdown, select **Group**, **User**, or **APP/Service Account**, and then select **Apply**.\n-1. Make a selection from the results list.\n-\n-1. To attach a role, select **Add role**.\n-1. In the **Add Role** page, from the **Available Roles** list, select the plus sign **(+)** to move the role to the **Selected Roles** list.\n-1. When you have finished adding roles, select **Submit**.\n-1. When the following message displays: **Are you sure you want to change permission?**, select:\n-    - **Generate Script** to generate a script where you can manually add/remove the permissions you selected.\n-    - **Execute** to change the permission.\n-    - **Close** to cancel the action.\n-\n-## Remove a role\n-\n-1. On the Permissions Management home page, select the **Remediation** tab, and then select the **Permissions** subtab.\n-1. From the **Authorization System Type** dropdown, select **Azure** or **GCP**.\n-1. From the **Authorization System** dropdown, select the accounts you want to access.\n-1. From the **Search For** dropdown, select **Group**, **User**, or **APP/Service Account**, and then select **Apply**.\n-1. Make a selection from the results list.\n-\n-1. To remove a role, select **Remove Role**.\n-1. In the **Remove Role** page, from the **Available Roles** list, select the plus sign **(+)** to move the role to the **Selected Roles** list.\n-1. When you have finished selecting roles, select **Submit**.\n-1. When the following message displays: **Are you sure you want to change permission?**, select:\n-    - **Generate Script** to generate a script where you can manually add/remove the permissions you selected.\n-    - **Execute** to change the permission.\n-    - **Close** to cancel the action.\n-\n-## Add a task\n-\n-1. On the Permissions Management home page, select the **Remediation** tab, and then select the **Permissions** subtab.\n-1. From the **Authorization System Type** dropdown, select **Azure** or **GCP**.\n-1. From the **Authorization System** dropdown, select the accounts you want to access.\n-1. From the **Search For** dropdown, select **Group**, **User**, or **APP/Service Account**, and then select **Apply**.\n-1. Make a selection from the results list.\n-\n-1. To attach a role, select **Add Tasks**.\n-1. In the **Add Tasks** page, from the **Available Tasks** list, select the plus sign **(+)** to move the task to the **Selected Tasks** list.\n-1. When you have finished adding tasks, select **Submit**.\n-1. When the following message displays: **Are you sure you want to change permission?**, select:\n-    - **Generate Script** to generate a script where you can manually add/remove the permissions you selected.\n-    - **Execute** to change the permission.\n-    - **Close** to cancel the action.\n-\n-## Remove a task\n-\n-1. On the Permissions Management home page, select the **Remediation** tab, and then select the **Permissions** subtab.\n-1. From the **Authorization System Type** dropdown, select **Azure** or **GCP**.\n-1. From the **Authorization System** dropdown, select the accounts you want to access.\n-1. From the **Search For** dropdown, select **Group**, **User**, or **APP/Service Account**, and then select **Apply**.\n-1. Make a selection from the results list.\n-\n-1. To remove a task, select **Remove Tasks**.\n-1. In the **Remove Tasks** page, from the **Available Tasks** list, select the plus sign **(+)** to move the task to the **Selected Tasks** list.\n-1. When you have finished selecting tasks, select **Submit**.\n-1. When the following message displays: **Are you sure you want to change permission?**, select:\n-    - **Generate Script** to generate a script where you can manually add/remove the permissions you selected.\n-    - **Execute** to change the permission.\n-    - **Close** to cancel the action.\n-\n-## Next steps\n-\n-\n-- For information on how to view existing roles/policies, requests, and permissions, see [View roles/policies, requests, and permission in the Remediation dashboard](ui-remediation.md).\n-- To view information about roles/policies, see [View information about roles/policies](how-to-view-role-policy.md)."
  },

    "sha": "a86bda1281c2494622a6b214cf46ce9b5902aa9b",
    "filename": "docs/permissions-management/how-to-add-remove-user-to-group.md",
    "status": "removed",
    "additions": 0,
    "deletions": 50,
    "changes": 50,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fhow-to-add-remove-user-to-group.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fhow-to-add-remove-user-to-group.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fhow-to-add-remove-user-to-group.md?ref=446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a",
    "patch": "@@ -1,50 +0,0 @@\n----\n-title: Add or remove a user in Microsoft Entra Permissions Management through the Microsoft Entra admin center\n-description: How to add or remove a user in Microsoft Entra Permissions Management through the Microsoft Enter admin center.\n-author: jenniferf-skc\n-manager: pmwongera\n-ms.service: entra-permissions-management\n-\n-ms.topic: how-to\n-ms.date: 05/02/2025\n-ms.author: jfields\n----\n-\n-# Add or remove a user in Microsoft Entra Permissions Management\n-\n-> [!NOTE]\n-> Effective April 1, 2025, Microsoft Entra Permissions Management will no longer be available for purchase, and on November 1, 2025, we'll retire and discontinue support of this product. More information can be found [here](https://aka.ms/MEPMretire).\n-\n-This article describes how you can add or remove a new user for a group in Permissions Management. \n-\n-> [!NOTE] \n-> Permissions Management entitlements work through group-based access. To add a new user, you must add a user to a group through Microsoft Entra ID.\n-\n-## Add a user\n-\n-1. Sign in to the [Microsoft Entra admin center](https://entra.microsoft.com/#home) as at least a [Billing Administrator](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2254515).\n-1. Browse to **Entra ID**, then select **Go to Microsoft Entra ID**. \n-1. From the navigation pane, go to **Entra ID** > **Groups** > **All groups**.\n-1. Select the group name for the group you want to add the user to.\n-1. From the group's **Manage** menu, click **Members**.\n-1. Click **+ Add members**, then search for the user you want to add from the list.\n-    > [!NOTE]\n-    > In order to add a user to a group, you must be the group owner. If you're not the owner of the selected group, please reach out to the group owner. If you don't know who the owner of the group is, select **Owners** under the group's **Manage** menu.\n-1. Click **Select**. Your user has been added. \n-1. Click the **Refresh** button to refresh your screen and view the user you've added.\n-\n-## Remove a user\n-\n-1. Sign in to the [Microsoft Entra admin center](https://entra.microsoft.com/#home) as at least a [Billing Administrator](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2254515).\n-1. Browse to **Entra ID**, then select **Go to Microsoft Entra ID**. \n-1. From the navigation pane, go to **Entra ID** > **Groups** > **All groups**.\n-1. Select the group name for the group you want to remove the user from.\n-1. From the groups **Manage** menu, click **Members**.\n-1. Search for the user you want to remove from the list, then check the box next to their name.\n-    > [!NOTE]\n-    > In order to remove a user from a group, you must be the group owner. If you're not the owner of the selected group, please reach out to the group owner. If you don't know who the owner of the group is, select **Owners** under the group's **Manage** menu.\n-1. Click **X Remove**, then click **Yes**. The user is removed from the group.\n-\n-## Next steps\n-\n-- For more information on managing users and groups, see [Manage users and groups with the User management dashboard](ui-user-management.md)."
  },
  {
    "sha": "4156e0b99c408ea55ae2675d3e70989cd98bd1a5",
    "filename": "docs/permissions-management/how-to-attach-detach-permissions.md",
    "status": "removed",
    "additions": 0,
    "deletions": 71,
    "changes": 71,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fhow-to-attach-detach-permissions.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fhow-to-attach-detach-permissions.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fpermissions-management%2Fhow-to-attach-detach-permissions.md?ref=446cdc04b6fcc1b18c873488f029e3b613daa30a",
    "patch": "@@ -1,71 +0,0 @@\n----\n-title: Attach and detach permissions for users, roles, and groups for Amazon Web Services (AWS) identities in the Remediation dashboard\n-description: How to attach and detach permissions for users, roles, and groups for Amazon Web Services (AWS) identities in the Remediation dashboard in Permissions Management.\n-author: jenniferf-skc\n-manager: pmwongera\n-ms.service: entra-permissions-management\n-\n-ms.topic: how-to\n-ms.date: 04/01/2025\n-ms.author: jfields\n----\n-\n-# Attach and detach policies for Amazon Web Services (AWS) identities\n-\n-> [!NOTE]\n-> Effective April 1, 2025, Microsoft Entra Permissions Management will no longer be available for purchase, and on November 1, 2025, we'll retire and discontinue support of this product. More information can be found [here](https://aka.ms/MEPMretire).\n-\n-This article describes how you can attach and detach permissions for users, roles, and groups for Amazon Web Services (AWS) identities using the **Remediation** dashboard.\n-\n-> [!NOTE]\n-> To view the **Remediation** tab, your must have **Viewer**, **Controller**, or **Administrator** permissions. To make changes on this tab, you must have **Controller** or **Administrator** permissions. If you don't have these permissions, contact your system administrator.\n-\n-## View permissions\n-\n-1. On the Permissions Management home page, select the **Remediation** tab, and then select the **Permissions** subtab.\n-1. From the **Authorization System Type** dropdown, select **AWS**.\n-1. From the **Authorization System** dropdown, select the accounts you want to access.\n-1. From the **Search For** dropdown, select **Group**, **User**, or **Role**.\n-1. To search for more parameters, you can make a selection from the **User States**, **Permission Creep Index**, and **Task Usage** dropdowns.\n-1. Select **Apply**.\n-    Permissions Management displays a list of users, roles, or groups that match your criteria.\n-1. In **Enter a username**, enter or select a user.\n-1. In **Enter a group name**, enter or select a group, then select **Apply**.\n-1. Make a selection from the results list.\n-\n-    The table displays the related **Username** **Domain/Account**, **Source** and **Policy Name**.\n-\n-\n-## Attach policies\n-\n-1. On the Permissions Management home page, select the **Remediation** tab, and then select the **Permissions** subtab.\n-1. From the **Authorization System Type** dropdown, select **AWS**.\n-1. In **Enter a username**, enter or select a user.\n-1. In **Enter a Group Name**, enter or select a group, then select **Apply**.\n-1. Make a selection from the results list.\n-1. To attach a policy, select **Attach Policies**.\n-1. In the **Attach Policies** page, from the **Available policies** list, select the plus sign **(+)** to move the policy to the **Selected policies** list.\n-1. When you have finished adding policies, select **Submit**.\n-1. When the following message displays: **Are you sure you want to change permission?**, select:\n-    - **Generate Script** to generate a script where you can manually add/remove the permissions you selected.\n-    - **Execute** to change the permission.\n-    - **Close** to cancel the action.\n-\n-## Detach policies\n-\n-1. On the Permissions Management Permissions Management home page, select the **Remediation** tab, and then select the **Permissions** subtab.\n-1. From the **Authorization System Type** dropdown, select **AWS**.\n-1. In **Enter a username**, enter or select a user.\n-1. In **Enter a Group Name**, enter or select a group, then select **Apply**.\n-1. Make a selection from the results list.\n-1. To remove a policy, select **Detach Policies**.\n-1. In the **Detach Policies** page, from the **Available policies** list, select the plus sign **(+)** to move the policy to the **Selected policies** list.\n-1. When you have finished selecting policies, select **Submit**.\n-1. When the following message displays: **Are you sure you want to change permission?**, select:\n-    - **Generate Script** to generate a script where you can manually add/remove the permissions you selected.\n-    - **Execute** to change the permission.\n-    - **Close** to cancel the action.\n-\n-## Next steps\n-\n-- To create or approve a request for permissions, see [Create or approve a request for permissions](how-to-create-approve-privilege-request.md)."
  },
  {
    "sha": "7c5f284699b5ee4a0a5dd4f3a05a94cba535a28e",
